image.altText: A portrait of 10-year-old Matilda, the youngest victim of the Bondi Beach shooting

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley calls on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to recall parliament to implement a suite of changes to combat antisemitism.

title.children: PM announces reforms to combat 'evil scourge'

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and earrings looks at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: NT Police has doubled its reward for information related to the disappearance of Angie Fuller, almost three years after her suspected murder in outback Australia.

title.children: 'We believe Angie was murdered': Fresh appeal for answers on missing mum

image.altText: A man and a woman standing in a field of barley.

props.synopsis: Amid the red dirt, termite mounds and buffel grass, the first barley harvest is finished at Central Australia's Athelle Outback Hideaway.

title.children: Can you grow barley in the desert? Outback Farm stars say yes

image.altText: A street sign

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 47-year-old man with murder three years after the death of a woman who was found unconscious on a street corner in Katherine.

title.children: Man charged with murder three years after woman's death in Katherine

image.altText: A dark blue sky, with the black silhouette of a wire fence.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal-owned business is suing the NT government for allegedly withholding more than $1 million in payments as part of a "campaign" to remove its contract for delivering alternatives to youth detention.

title.children: NT government accused of 'campaign' to axe youth justice contract

image.altText: A man writes on a white clipboard in a red pen.

props.synopsis: Aspiring Darwin filmmakers with disabilities have been getting job-ready, developing skills in scriptwriting, directing, cinematography and editing. It is the first time the program has been offered in the NT, with plans for it to expand even further.

title.children: Filmmaking program giving storytellers with disabilities a platform

image.altText: Suzi with short blonde hair wearing glasses talks to the camera.

props.synopsis: Former Darwin real estate agent Suzi Milgate has been found guilty of aggravated assault after pushing a cream-covered crepe into the face of a former Northern Territory chief minister.

title.children: Suzi Milgate guilty of aggravated assault over crepe attack

image.altText: NT Police insignia on mud-splattered car door.

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 27-year-old man with his partner's murder after she was found unresponsive in the remote community of Borroloola, south-east of Darwin.

title.children: NT Police charge man, 27, with murder after partner's 'suspicious' death

image.altText: A woman with a brown complexion, long black wavy hair, wearing a blue blazer school uniform, holding 2 certificates

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's top-scoring year 12 students have been celebrated at a ceremony at Parliament House, with some keen to pursue teaching careers inspired by the classroom support they received

title.children: Future teachers among NT's highest-scoring year 12 students

image.altText: A collage of a person with disability, a hand on a wheelchair and kids throwing a ball

props.synopsis: The government confirms two categories of NDIS providers will be subject to mandatory registration, more than a year after it was handed recommendations for how to implement a new system.

title.children: 'Shape up or ship out': NDIS providers warned as new rules confirmed

image.altText: A year 12 student facetimes their mum after receiving their ATAR mark

props.synopsis: Students at Delany College in Granville are among the 83,000 students across NSW who are learning of their HSC results on Thursday.

title.children: With a 98.70 ATAR, Sidney shared an elated video call with his mum

image.altText: A woman with a checkered shirt wearing a fixed microphone speaks at a conference

props.synopsis: The chief executive of Perth-based oil and gas producer Woodside, Meg O'Neill, resigns from the company effective immediately in order to take up the same role at BP.

title.children: Meg O'Neill resigns as Woodside chief to join energy giant

image.altText: Sarah Court in front of ASIC logo

props.synopsis: Financial services company Netwealth has agreed to pay more than $100 million to more than 1,000 clients who invested in the failed First Guardian super fund through its platform.

title.children: Netwealth strikes $100m ASIC deal to compensate First Guardian investors

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: Optus has released the report into how and why Triple Zero calls failed to go through earlier this year, while the ASX is lower following a tech sell-down on Wall Street. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX falls amid tech sell-down on Wall Street

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia's population grows at slower rate to 27.6 million
Most companies on ASX 200 down as uranium miners caught in sell-off
Australian household wealth rises by $550 billion in September quarter, ABS data reveals

image.altText: A woman stands arms crossed in front of a pub window covered in Christmas decorations.

props.synopsis: When Leylanie moved her family back to her home town a year ago, she did not expect to be spending this Christmas still living out of a motel.

title.children: Mum pays $1,000 a week to live in a motel in her home town

image.altText: Albanese holds up a Medicare card.

props.synopsis: Labor has two options when it comes to straddling a budget in the red and accusations it has become a green Grinch on health funding.

title.children: Party allegiance counts for little when there's $121 billion worth of problems

image.altText: Anthony Albanese surrounded by police.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced sweeping reforms to crack down on antisemitism in the wake of the deadly terror attack on Sydney's Jewish community.

title.children: 'I'm not perfect': PM's concession as he reveals hate speech law reforms

image.altText: A man standing on a sunny cliff in the city with water behind him

props.synopsis: A man who showed no remorse after a stabbing attack on his partner in their south Sydney home is sentenced to more than 26 years in jail for the woman's murder.

title.children: Man jailed for 'cowardly and inexcusable' murder of partner

image.altText: A courtroom sketch shows Nick Reiner wearing a blue protective vest as he sits in the dock.

props.synopsis: Nick Reiner briefly faces court three days after he was arrested over the stabbing murders of his Hollywood director father, Rob Reiner, and mother, Michele Singer Reiner.

title.children: Rob Reiner's son Nick appears in court charged with parents' stabbing deaths

image.altText: KPop Demon Hunters

props.synopsis: From Australian-made gore to sugar-rush animation, here are the films that had our critics seated and watching this year.

title.children: The best new movies of 2025 from Sinners to KPop Demon Hunters

image.altText: A singer hugs an old woman who looks very happy.

props.synopsis: A performer and an advocate for older Australians are worried that live entertainment for aged care residents is on the decline as other leisure activities, such as virtual reality, gain popularity.

title.children: Embracing live entertainment's 'human connection' in aged care centres

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Kerry Schott's report into the Triple Zero outage debacle increases pressure on Optus to implement 21 recommendations, some of them "urgent", and highlights numerous errors.

title.children: Optus in race against time after damning Triple Zero outage review

image.altText: An image of a boat parked on a suburban street, with parts of the boat blurred.

props.synopsis: Lake Macquarie man Jake Dearie has been refused bail after being charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on his boat.

title.children: Man denied bail for 'blatant' alleged display of Nazi symbols on boat

image.altText: A headshot of a young woman with blonde hair looking off camera.

props.synopsis: After new breakthroughs in the search for missing tourist Celine Cremer in the dense Tasmanian bush, the wait begins for the results of forensic tests on items discovered in the forest.

title.children: Searchers hope Celine Cremer's phone may reveal new clues

image.altText: Man in patterned shirt smiling, leaning against tree.

props.synopsis: Prostate cancer survivor Mick Barrett is calling on businesses to consider installing rubbish bins inside men's bathrooms to help those with incontinence.

title.children: Sanitary bins aren't always in men's bathrooms. Here's why that's a problem

image.altText: A man stares down the barrel of a camera while sitting in a room, wearing all black.

props.synopsis: The man who stabbed two Australian National University students in 2023 is given a nominated sentence of life to be carried out in a secure mental health facility.

title.children: ANU stabber 'may never be safe for release into the community'

image.altText: Tracy Beaton smiles, has hands in pockets of black pants, wears glasses, green and beige printed shirt.

props.synopsis: The Allan Labor government has appointed Tracy Beaton to head the Commission for Children and Young People, as Victoria continues to grapple with its childcare crisis.

title.children: Victorian children's commissioner appointed after nine-month vacancy

image.altText: A pile of building rubble on burnt ground with tall trees in background.

props.synopsis: Parts of WA's Indigenous community are in mourning, while others have mixed feelings, after a former mission where members of the Stolen Generation were institutionalised was partly destroyed in a bushfire.

title.children: Indigenous community mourns Stolen Generation mission site destroyed by fire

image.altText: Tim Tszyu throws a punch against Anthony Velazquez

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu has comfortably defeated American Anthony Velazquez, winning by unanimous decision at the Sydney Entertainment Centre.

title.children: Tim Tszyu dominates in blood-soaked return to the ring

image.altText: A picture of the golden FIFA World Cup trophy on a pedestal at a reception ahead of the World Cup draw.

props.synopsis: FIFA has announced a record prize money pool for the 2026 men's World Cup, but the figures are dwarfed by the riches on offer for the biggest club competitions, and fly in the face of the deadline for parity with the women's tournament.

title.children: FIFA's record men's World Cup prize pool undermines equal pay goal

image.altText: Sam Kerr celebrates with teammate Johanna Rytting Kaneryd.

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr heads in the winner as Chelsea secures a spot in the Women's Champions League quarterfinals.

title.children: Kerr scores the winner for Chelsea to lock in Champions League quarterfinal

image.altText: A man in a black suit looks into the camera as he reads from a sheet.

props.synopsis: Charles James Spencer-Churchill, 70, who is known as Jamie Blandford, is the 12th Duke of Marlborough, one of Britain's most senior aristocratic families.

title.children: UK's Duke of Marlborough charged with intentional strangulation

image.altText: Logos of Paramount, Netflix and Warner Bros brought together in one illustration.

props.synopsis: In a letter to shareholders, the board wrote that Paramount had "consistently misled" Warner Bros shareholders that its $US30-per-share cash offer was fully guaranteed, or "backstopped," by the Ellison family,

title.children: Warner Bros rejects rival $163bn bid from Paramount

image.altText: A woman sitting at a desk with a laptop.

props.synopsis: Most people spent time doing unpaid work in 2024, according to new data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics. It found women spent on average an hour more doing unpaid work than men.

title.children: These charts show how Australians are spending their time
